author: Special Correspondent
text:
Having received overwhelming support and response from the residents during its second week on March 6, the ‘Car-Free Sundays’ initiative by The Hindu Tamil in partnership with Coimbatore Corporation and Coimbatore City Traffic Police is all set for its third week on March 13.

A variety of events are lined up for the participants on NSR Road in Coimbatore from 6.30 a.m. to 9 a.m. The Hindu – English is the media partner.

Events

The events are as follows: a fitness training session for 20 minutes by Beethovan at 6.30 a.m.; a street play by students of SNR College; a variety dance performance by students of Avila Convent at 7.15 a.m.; a zombie act performance by Ranjith at 7.45 a.m.; Illusionist Tharun Iyer will entertain the guests at 7.50 a.m.; a 20-minute yoga session by K. Rangaswamy and dance by Euro Kids school for 15 minutes at 8.30 a.m.

Noyyalai Nokki

An audio on ‘Noyyalai Nokki’ –an initiative in the offing to reclaim River Noyyal–will be played, after which Vanitha Mohan, Managing Trustee of Siruthuli, will address the public. The Noyyalai Nokki initiative is to be launched at Madhvarayapuram village in Alandurai on March 26. The entire 800 meter stretch on NSR Road would be open for sketching portraits, tattooing, children displaying their drawing skills, cycling, and a host of games by residents and children.
title: Car-Free Sundays all set for third week
